meanings.definition: To buy goods and sell them at a higher price.
meanings.sent1: She decided to regrate the vintage clothes she bought at the thrift store.
meanings.sent2: The store owner would often regrate rare items to make a profit.
meanings.sent3: John tried to regrate the old books he found in his attic, hoping to make some extra money.
meanings.sent4: The businessman had a knack for regrating luxury watches to wealthy clients.
meanings.sent5: The art dealer knew how to regrate paintings to collectors for a significant markup.

meanings.definition: To sell goods again at a higher price.
meanings.sent1: After buying the limited edition sneakers, she planned to regrate them online.
meanings.sent2: Some people regrate concert tickets to make a profit.
meanings.sent3: The kids tried to regrate their toys to each other, pretending to be shop owners.
meanings.sent4: The scalper would regrate tickets outside the stadium before big games.
meanings.sent5: He would regrate vintage toys at flea markets for a higher price.

meanings.definition: To buy goods and sell them again at a higher price.
meanings.sent1: The street vendor would regrate imported goods to tourists in the city.
meanings.sent2: She liked to regrate handmade jewelry she found at local markets.
meanings.sent3: The young entrepreneur attempted to regrate handmade candles to upscale boutiques.
meanings.sent4: He would regrate rare coins at auctions for a substantial profit.
meanings.sent5: The online seller knew how to regrate limited edition sneakers to sneakerheads.
